post_text: THANK YOU, Colonie EMS Department and Colonie Police Department!💙💙💙#InThisTogether
shared_text:
Colonie EMS Department is at Shaker Junior High School.
May 14 at 4:04 PM · Latham, NY ·

Colonie EMS and Colonie PD found out Tuesday evening that there was a need to stock the pantry for the North Colonie Central School District Back Pack Program.

The BackPack Program helps alleviate child hunger by discreetly providing hungry children with backpacks full of nutritious and easy-to-prepare food on Friday afternoons so they have food to eat throughout the weekend. During the closure of schools, the program has been providing food more than ever.

In just over 24 hours the members of Colonie EMS donated enough food to fill the back of an ambulance! Partnering with Colonie PD the food pantry got quite the stock up today!

It is nothing short of amazing the dedication to the community the members of Colonie Public Safety have - we are truly proud to be part of such an amazing team!

#TOCtakesonCOVID19
#SociallyDistantYetCloserThanEver
#ColoniePublicSafety
#ThankfulThursday
#WorkingTogetherForYou
#ThisIsColonie

post_text: Ten Loudonville students in 4th, 5th and 6th grade competed in the first round of the national competition of the Geography Bee on Jan. 30. Charlie Adelstein, a sixth grade student, won first place with Antonio Luzcando, a fifth grade student, winning second place and Nolan Parra, a fifth grade student, finishing in third place! Bravo to all contestants! Congratulations, Charles! This school competition moderated by Mrs. Rebecca Coffey, fourth grade Loudonville Elementary teacher, is the first round in the annual National Geographic GeoBee, a geography competition designed to inspire and reward students’ curiosity about the world. Questions cover not only geography, but also ancient and world civilizations, cultures and physical features.

Over April break, the SJHS Student Council sponsored a 5-day trip to Washington, DC for junior high students. Trip participants toured the Capitol and the White House, visited the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum, the National Portrait Gallery, the Newseum, saw a show at the Kennedy Center, went on a ghost tour in Old Town Alexandria, and walked through the monuments.

Two of the unique parts of the trip were hearing oral arguments at the Supreme Court of the United States and discussing them afterward with the Solicitor General and participating in a wreath-laying ceremony at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery.
